kontimārā： kontimārā（thī）
ကောန္တိမာရာ（ထီ）

Kontimārā：A river which flowed from the hill ārañjara．

Alongside this river ran the road taken by men who were banished by the people of Sibi； the road was also taken by Vessantara on his way to exile （J．vi．493）．

The river is five leagues from Suvannagiritāla and five from ārañjara．J．vi．514．

kontimārā：ကောန္တိမာရာ （ထီ）
